header_summary: Participants in an email thread discussed Bitcoin network policies and proposed solutions for channel jamming. They emphasized incentivizing traffic prioritization and mentioned factors like profitability and lower fees for new nodes. Concerns were raised about determining small fees and market influence, but regulating fees through market dynamics was suggested. The need for a hybrid approach to address channel jamming was agreed upon, with no further questions or alternative solutions raised.

recent_posts.title: Pull-req to enable Full-RBF by default
recent_posts.summary:
- Daniel Lipshitz's research on GAP600's acceptance of unconfirmed Bitcoin transactions has been criticized.
- Peter Todd disputes Lipshitz's claim, stating that Coinpayments and Coinspaid are payment processors, not individual merchants accepting unconfirmed payments.
- Todd challenges Lipshitz to provide evidence of an actual merchant and questions the impact of full Replace-by-Fee (RBF) on double spend rates for GAP600 transactions.

recent_posts.title: Announcing Libforesta
recent_posts.summary:
- Davidson Souza introduces `libfloresta`, a compact, ready-to-use Bitcoin full node for low-power devices.
- This project is based on `Floresta` and uses Rust logic with bindings to run anywhere.
- Davidson clarifies the consensus approach and encourages feedback while cross-testing against Bitcoin Core.

recent_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions". (ashneverdawn)
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion revolves around whether inscriptions should be considered spam or not.
- The importance of economic measures and practical solutions to prevent inscriptions is emphasized.
- The context highlights the challenges associated with inscriptions, IBD time, and UTXO size.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a scheme for multipath payments in the Lightning-dev mailing list.
- The scheme uses preimage embedding and XORing to ensure complete funds are claimed.
- The proposal enhances the functionality of the `keysend` protocol for flexible payment splitting.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- Our team has been recording and transcribing specification meetings every other Monday.
- Transcripts are now available to everyone for access at [https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification].
- Gurwinder at Chaincode reviewed and ensured the accuracy of the transcripts.

recent_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
recent_posts.summary:
- Participants discussed Bitcoin network policies and proposed solutions to address transaction-related issues.
- The discussion covered topics such as the "top of mempool" assumption, lightning unilateral closes, and zero-fee transactions.
- Concerns were raised about policy restrictions, dust unspent transaction outputs, and channel jamming mitigation.

active_posts.title: Standardisation of an unstructured taproot annex
active_posts.summary:
- The taproot annex is currently non-standard but consensus valid, with discussions on standardization leaning towards a flexible TLV format.
- Instead of waiting for a structured format, developers can use a non-structured taproot annex with '0' as free-form.
- This approach offers immediate utilization, future flexibility, and chainspace efficiency for various applications.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation discussed involves a blinded server that does not learn certain information.
- The security of blinded statechains relies on the statechain server's reporting of partial signatures.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol involves generating private and public keys, and aggregating them.

active_posts.title: On the experiment of the Bitcoin Contracting Primitives WG and marking this community process "up for grabs"
active_posts.summary:
- Last year, the failure of CTV and discussions about covenant proposals led to a new community process.
- Initiatives were undertaken, including the bitcoin-inquisition fork and archiving covenant proposals.
- The author decided not to pursue the process further, but encouraged others to continue their efforts.

active_posts.title: HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
active_posts.summary:
- The email updates on channel jamming and schedules the next call for May 1st.
- The group aims to gather data on HTLC endorsement and reputation tracking for jamming mitigation.
- The email proposes a reputation scheme for high reputation peers to endorse HTLCs for forwarding.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits team patched an exploit that allowed attackers to create bogus balances in invoices.
- The attack involves manipulating payment hashes to trick the backend into settling bogus payments.
- Developers should implement additional checks and refer to the payment hash as the "preimage hash."

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network offer privacy benefits for receiving nodes.
- Payments can only be made through given paths, potentially limiting destination accessibility.
- Concerns about compromised privacy and pressure from chain analysis companies are raised.
